pullRequest.body:
We rewrite the definition of homogeneous polynomial as a special case of weighted homogeneous polynomial.

Question: should all uses of `∑ i in d.support, d i` be replaced by `degree d`?

Co-authored-by: Antoine Chambert-Loir <antoine.chambert-loir@u-paris.fr>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thanks!

bors d+
That is a nice refactor! Could you indeed replace `∑ i in d.support, d i` with `degree d` throughout?

Thanks!

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion weightedDegree w f = Finsupp.sum f (fun i c => c • w i) := by ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · exact hn · exact absurd hx (hw x) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · intro hx ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · intro hax _ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · exact hn · exact absurd hx (hw x) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · intro hx ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · intro hx ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · intro hax _ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · intro hax _ ```

I think replacing `∑ i in d.support` with `degree` would make sense, but only if we reverse the direction of this theorem. (Can it be `@[simp]`?)
```suggestion
theorem weightedDegree_one (d : σ →₀ ℕ) :
    weightedDegree 1 d = degree d := by
  simp [weightedDegree, Finsupp.total, Finsupp.sum]
```

I have changed this as suggested, but I did not make it a simp lemma, because at least in this file we only use it to replace `degree` by `weigthedDegree` (to recover the proofs from the general case).

Idem:
```suggestion
theorem weightedTotalDegree_one (φ : MvPolynomial σ R) :
    weightedTotalDegree (1 : σ → ℕ) φ = φ.totalDegree := by
```
Nice work!
For completeness, could you also add a (`@[simp]`?) lemma stating `weightedHomogeneousSubmodule 1 R n = homogeneousSubmodule σ R n`?

How about the name:
```suggestion
theorem IsWeightedHomogeneous.weightedHomogeneousComponent_same
```

```suggestion
theorem IsWeightedHomogeneous.weightedHomogeneousComponent_ne
```

I can't find the string `non_trivial_weight_of` in mathlib 3, should this `#align` even exist?
```suggestion
```
You are right, this never made it to mathlib 3. I am also renaming `NonTrivialWeight` to `NonTorsionWeight`, following @AntoineChambert-Loir's suggestion.

Since `m` appears on both sides of the iff, we can probably make it implicit:
```suggestion
theorem weightedDegree_eq_zero_iff (hw : NonTrivialWeight w) {m : σ →₀ ℕ} :
    weightedDegree w m = 0 ↔ ∀ x : σ, m x = 0 := by
```

To match the theorem statement:
```suggestion
theorem totalDegree_zero_iff_isHomogeneous {p : MvPolynomial σ R} :
```
You can save a bit of work by using the `alias` command to derive this lemma from `totalDegree_zero_iff_isHomogeneous`.
What do you mean?

It's been a while so maybe I forgot some important context. It seems that we can just define this as:
```
alias ⟨isHomogeneous_of_totalDegree_zero, _⟩ := isHomogeneous_of_totalDegree_zero_iff
```

Let's keep the `←` with the rest of the `rw` rule:
```suggestion
  rw [totalDegree_eq_weightedTotalDegree, ← WithBot.coe_eq_coe,
      ← weightedTotalDegree_coe _ φ h, IsWeightedHomogeneous.weighted_total_degree hφ h]
```

```suggestion
theorem isHomogeneous_monomial {d : σ →₀ ℕ} (r : R) {n : ℕ} (hn : degree d = n) :
```

```suggestion
theorem coeff_eq_zero (hφ : IsHomogeneous φ n) {d : σ →₀ ℕ} (hd : degree d ≠ n) :
```
Do you need `DecidableEq M` in the statement?
Good catch, I don't. Thanks!
Same.
Can you add a doc to this and the following results?
Done!
